learning_objective: Model daily processes by creating and following algorithms (sets of step-by-step instructions) to complete tasks.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is trying to model the process of how 15th century explorers used the astrolabe during their expeditions. Using simple commands such as `turnRight`, `moveForward`, `lookAtStar`, `calculateAngle`, `determineDirection`, which of the following pseudo-codes best describes this process?",
    "Answer1": "start
turnRight
determineDirection
lookAtStar
calculateAngle
moveForward
end",
    "Answer2": "start
lookAtStar
turnRight
moveForward
calculateAngle
determineDirection
end",
    "Answer3": "start
lookAtStar
calculateAngle
determineDirection
moveForward
end",
    "Answer4": "start
determineDirection
lookAtStar
turnRight
calculateAngle
moveForward
end",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "The explorers had to first look at a star, then calculate its angle to determine their direction using the astrolabe. Once they knew which direction they had to go, they then moved forward in that direction. The actions `turnRight` does not properly represent any part of this historical process."
}
